channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Building material on road for over a year, 13th January
item.description:
For over a year. Building material has been on the road, taking up car spaces and also, does not have a permit to keep large amounts of building material the road
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Rushford Road, Honor Oak, Greater London

item.title: Rubbish littered all up the road., 13th January
item.description:
This seems to happen after every bin day. Residents of Wickham lane leaving wastage outside their properties over night and the foxes have their way with the rubbish. I completely get why, but the bin men do not clean the pavement / foot paths. So it often leaves rubbish along the road for days and sometimes weeks. I’m not sure when the street cleaners are meant to come but I rarely see them on Wickham Lane.
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Wickham Lane, Plumstead
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Household waste dumped / bed frame / suitcase, 13th January
item.description:
Several items dumped by the post box blocking access to the post box and road for mobility scooters. Items include: Single bed frame Several black bags of waste (assumption)x Suitcases.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Wickham Lane, Plumstead
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Rubbish at bus stop , no bin., 13th January
item.description:
There used to be a bin at the bus stop at the corner of Cedarhurst Drive and Eltham Road but was removed about two years ago. All under the seat and around the bus shelter is littered with rubbish, a lot of it from McDonald's. The re-reinstatement of the bin is urgently required. Thankyou.
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Eltham Road, Eltham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dead fox hit by car, 13th January
item.description:
A Horrible image of a dead fox body on the way to Tesco express. The fox has been hit by cat on Sunday morning, still lying on the pavement, opposite the AMOT and next to the Tesco express.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 31, Blackheath Road, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Street light broken on pathway, 12th January
item.description:
One of the lights is broken and has been for months - potential hazard at night and particularly in this weather as seen from the top of the hill in the attached photo. Please can this be sorted post haste

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Rock Hill, Dulwich, Greater London
